content:
• Monday, December 17, 2012
  • OCPNY

    Japanese shares are higher in early trade, extending their gains from yesterday on strength in...

    Japanese shares are higher in early trade, extending their gains from yesterday on strength in the yen and a boost from Wall Street overnight. The Nikkei Average is up 0.5% to 9,872, with blue-chip exporters leading: Olympus (OTCPK:OCPNY +2%), Sharp (OTCPK:SHCAY +5.7%), Mazda (OTCPK:MZDAY +1.3%), Kawasaki Heavy Industries (OTCPK:KWHIF +1.5%) and Nomura (NMR +3.5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 8:13 PM
  • YELP

    Yelp (YELP -2.7%) sold off after Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) announced a big revamp of its Nearby...

    Yelp (YELP -2.7%) sold off after Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) announced a big revamp of its Nearby feature for its iOS and Android apps. The feature now provides a list of local businesses Facebook thinks a user might be interested in, along with user ratings and filtering/sharing options. TechCrunch's Josh Constine is impressed with Nearby's interface and the effectiveness of its business-ranking algorithm. But Yelp still has its unmatched reviews database as a selling point. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:54 PM
  • BAC

    Financials add to the regular session's big gains as Meredeth Whitney gets bullish on the...

    Financials add to the regular session's big gains as Meredeth Whitney gets bullish on the sector, particularly Bank of America, Citigroup, and Discover. The catalyst for the group will be the March release of the Fed's stress tests showing them adequately capitalized, paving the way for more share repurchases and dividend bumps. BAC +2.1%, C +0.5%, DFS +2.3%, XLF +0.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:50 PM | 8 Comments
  • DFS

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: DFS +2.4%. TWO +2.3%. BAC +2.1%. UNIS +1.8%. RF...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: DFS +2.4%. TWO +2.3%. BAC +2.1%. UNIS +1.8%. RF +1.1%. 
    After-hours top losers: PHG -6%. RAS -5.5%. RMTI -3.4%. NWY -2.8%. UVXY -1.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • GPOR

    Gulfport Energy (NASDAQ:GPOR) agrees to purchase 30K net acres in the Utica Shale in Ohio from...

    Gulfport Energy (NASDAQ:GPOR) agrees to purchase 30K net acres in the Utica Shale in Ohio from an affiliate of Wexford Capital for ~$300M, increasing GPOR's Utica leasehold interests to ~99K net acres. To fund the deal, GPOR plans a public offering of 9M common shares. GPOR -3.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM
  • SOMX

    Somaxon Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SOMX) says that its licensee Paladin Labs has received approval...

    Somaxon Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SOMX) says that its licensee Paladin Labs has received approval from Health Canada for its New Drug Submission for its insomnia treatment Silenor. The drug's launch is expected to around mid-2013. Shares +1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • SLS

    Galena Biopharma (GALE) slips 14% in the post-session after saying it intends to offer common...

    Galena Biopharma (GALE) slips 14% in the post-session after saying it intends to offer common stock and warrants for an unspecified amount. The company intends to use the net proceeds to conduct ongoing clinical trials for NeuVax and its Folate Binding Protein-E39. Piper Jaffray is acting as the sole book-running manager for the offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • VELTF

    Velti (VELT +18.5%) finished the day with a giant gain after announcing a CFO change. Jeff Ross,...

    Velti (VELT +18.5%) finished the day with a giant gain after announcing a CFO change. Jeff Ross, previously CFO of SAP's Sybase unit, will be replacing Wilson Cheung, who will "transition into a new role" in Velti's Asian ops. Velti's high collection times, and the revenue fallout the company will see from its efforts to lower those times, had led to concerns about its financial management. 38.3% of the float was shorted as of Nov. 30.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • TWO

    Two Harbors (NYSE:TWO) gains 2.2% AH after declaring a $0.55 Q4 dividend, up from $0.36 last...

    Two Harbors (NYSE:TWO) gains 2.2% AH after declaring a $0.55 Q4 dividend, up from $0.36 last quarter. The company doesn't break out how much of this is from recurring income, and how much from the sale of its single-family property portfolio to Silver Bay (NYSE:SBY) and the realized gains from MBS sales. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • RVBD

    Riverbed (RVBD +6.1%) rallied over the course of the day to finish at $18.85. The company...

    Riverbed (RVBD +6.1%) rallied over the course of the day to finish at $18.85. The company recently announced that Gartner estimates its Q3 share of the WAN optimization hardware market was a solid 52.5%. That's evidence Riverbed's dominant position hasn't been seriously affected by recent product transition and sales cycle issues, in spite of competition from Cisco, F5, and others.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • DMND

    Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND): FQ1 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $258.5M (-10.5% Y/Y)...

    Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND): FQ1 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $258.5M (-10.5% Y/Y) misses by $16M. Shares +2.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 2 Comments
  • SVM

    Silvercorp Metals (SVM -6.3%) says power to the area in China's Ying Mining District, where...

    Silvercorp Metals (SVM -6.3%) says power to the area in China's Ying Mining District, where three mines are located, will be temporarily suspended due to work by the local power authority. SVM expects the power suspension will result in a reduction of ~5,000 metric tons of ore production; the main SGX mine will not be affected as its power is supplied through a different line.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • CTIC

    Cell Therapeutics (CTIC +2.8%) moves higher today after publishing positive results from a...

    Cell Therapeutics (CTIC +2.8%) moves higher today after publishing positive results from a pre-clinical study of Pixuvri in The Journal of Pharmacology and Experimental Therapeutics. The study showed that in a human cardiac tissue model treated with Pixuvri did not form reactive oxygen species or long lived hydroxymetabolites. Additionally, the drug inhibited formation of the long-lived hydroxymetabolite of doxorubicin, which suggests a low incidence of cardiotoxicity.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • RVM

    Revett Minerals (RVM -10%) temporarily suspends underground mining operations at its Troy Mine...

    Revett Minerals (RVM -10%) temporarily suspends underground mining operations at its Troy Mine in Montana due to concerns about underground geotechnical conditions. RVM believes it may take up to two weeks to assess, monitor and return to full operations.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • AIG

    AIG prices the sale of its remaining 1.65B shares of AIA Group at  HK$29.65 to HK$30.65....

    AIG prices the sale of its remaining 1.65B shares of AIA Group at  HK$29.65 to HK$30.65. The mid-point of that range would be a 4.6% discount to what the stock was last trading at (AIA was halted in HK last night before the open). The pink sheet version (OTCPK:AAGIY) is off 3.1%. AIG - with another $6.5B maybe to put towards buybacks - is up 2.6%. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • SQNM

    Sequenom (SQNM -1%) bounces back after saying the USPTO has withdrawn the patent on the...

    Sequenom (SQNM -1%) bounces back after saying the USPTO has withdrawn the patent on the company's Diagnosing Fetal Chromosomal Aneuploidy Using Massively Parallel Genomic Sequencing. The agency said it was withdrawn in connection with an anticipated patent interference proceeding between parties with pending patent applications or issued patents directed to similar subject matter.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • HERO

    Hercules Offshore (HERO +5.2%) is raised to Buy from Hold with a price target of $8 from $4 at...

    Hercules Offshore (HERO +5.2%) is raised to Buy from Hold with a price target of $8 from $4 at Deutsche Bank, which cites improving demand and pricing in the commodity jack-up business. The firm sees HERO as one of the most gas leveraged names as the shallow Gulf of Mexico operators likely will make decisions on drilling economics, and rig capacity growth is highly unlikely.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • ARIA

    Shares of Ariad Pharmaceutical (ARIA +5.7%) get a boost today as a number of firms come out in...

    Shares of Ariad Pharmaceutical (ARIA +5.7%) get a boost today as a number of firms come out in defense of the stock following last weeks drubbing. The FDA approved its leukemia treatment Iclusig, but with an unexpected boxed warning. Jefferies says the safety issues are hard to pinpoint directly to the drug and lowers its price target, but reiterates a Buy on the shares. Maxim reiterates a Buy as well, saying the potentially lower penetration due to reduced prescriptions is partially offset by a higher-than-expected selling price.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • INT

    World Fuel Services (INT +2.1%) agrees to acquire assets of Multi Service, which specializes in...

    World Fuel Services (INT +2.1%) agrees to acquire assets of Multi Service, which specializes in fleet, government and commercial payment programs, for $137M. INT expects the transaction to be $0.16-$0.20 accretive to earnings on a non-GAAP basis in the first 12 months. The deal will be funded mostly through existing credit facilities.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • MLNX

    EZchip (EZCH -2.1%) slumps after Value Bulldog makes a short case on Seeking Alpha Pro. The...

    EZchip (EZCH -2.1%) slumps after Value Bulldog makes a short case on Seeking Alpha Pro. The author questions EZchip's low R&D and sales spending, and notes the company has often let down analysts forecasting major sales growth. Concerns are also raised about the addressable market for high-speed network processors (NPUs), competition from Broadcom's (BRCM) BCM88030 NPU, and the fact Alcatel-Lucent and Juniper are relying on their own edge router NPUs (though market leader Cisco remains a big EZchip buyer).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 6 Comments
  • LXRX

    Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (LXRX +8%) gets a pop today after earlier saying it's received fast...

    Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (LXRX +8%) gets a pop today after earlier saying it's received fast track status from the FDA for LX1033, its orally-delivered drug candidate for diarrhea-predominant irritable bowel syndrome. The drug inhibits the reaction of tryptophan hydroxylase in the gastrointestinal tract, and is currently being evaluated in Phase II clinical trials.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM
  • NOK

    Nokia (NOK +4.7%) has cracked the $4 barrier today. Possibly helping is a Bloomberg report that...

    Nokia (NOK +4.7%) has cracked the $4 barrier today. Possibly helping is a Bloomberg report that HTC has shelved plans for a large-screen Windows Phone due to the fact WP8 doesn't currently support 1080p displays. HTC recently launched the Droid DNA, an Android phone with a 5" 1080p display.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM | 28 Comments
  • OCZ

    OCZ (OCZ +12.7%) is among the day's big tech winners. There isn't any major news to fuel the...

    OCZ (OCZ +12.7%) is among the day's big tech winners. There isn't any major news to fuel the rally, unless one counts an announcement for a caching solution for Linux systems using OCZ's enterprise solid-state drives. Shares have been quite volatile in recent days, no doubt thanks to a heavy short interest, and are up 68% from their Nov. 23 low.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • PAY

    VeriFone Systems (PAY -2.8%) drops off after the company becomes the target of a $250M lawsuit...

    VeriFone Systems (PAY -2.8%) drops off after the company becomes the target of a $250M lawsuit alleging breach of contract over in-taxi advertising.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM
  • HPQ

    H-P (HPQ -4%) is giving back some of its recent gains after Deutsche's Chris Whitmore argues the...

    H-P (HPQ -4%) is giving back some of its recent gains after Deutsche's Chris Whitmore argues the stumbling IT giant isn't worth more broken up than in one piece. Whitmore, no stranger to criticizing H-P, thinks the company "is better served remaining whole due to significant cross business unit synergies, branding leverage, corporate overhead leverage and other associated scale advantages." H-P has rallied partly on hopes Carl Icahn would lead an activist push for a breakup.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • GNVC

    Shares of biopharmaceutical developer GenVec (GNVC +37%) surge after the company reported...

    Shares of biopharmaceutical developer GenVec (GNVC +37%) surge after the company reported earlier that a single dose of its genetic vaccine showed it was effective against Herpes Simplex Virus or HSV2 in two industry-accepted HSV disease models. The company added that immunization was also shown to reduce viral shedding and the recurrence and severity of lesions.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • GNVC

    Midday top 10 gainers: GNVC +37%. CBOU +30%. HRT +16%. CEDC +15%. OCZ +13%. CPWR +13%. ONCY...

    Midday top 10 gainers: GNVC +37%. CBOU +30%. HRT +16%. CEDC +15%. OCZ +13%. CPWR +13%. ONCY +13%. JVA +12%. VELT +12%. HTCH +12%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: SCL -48%. GYRO -31%. END -20%. OPXA -13%. CLWR -12%. XUE -12%. SSE-OLD -11%. ALIM -11%. RVM -11%. NBG -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • PHMD

    PhotoMedex (PHMD -2%) gives back early gains after the company announced earlier that it's...

    PhotoMedex (PHMD -2%) gives back early gains after the company announced earlier that it's signed a 2-year extension with Ya-Man, the exclusive distributor of its no!no! brand in Japan. The new agreement extends the same minimum order quantities and advertising budgets currently being serviced with the existing agreement, which was due to expire on December 31.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • BTU

    Peabody Energy's (BTU -2.1%) price target is lowered to $32 by Citigroup, which lowers its FY...

    Peabody Energy's (BTU -2.1%) price target is lowered to $32 by Citigroup, which lowers its FY 2013 EPS estimate well below consensus after BTU provided a preliminary Q1 and full-year 2013 outlook that came in lighter than expected.  Other coal names also slide: WLT -1.7%, ACI -1.4%, CLD -0.9%, ANR -0.5%, CNX -0.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM | 2 Comments
  • MRVL

    Cavium (CAVM -4.5%) slumps after disclosing COO Rajiv Khemani has resigned " to pursue...

    Cavium (CAVM -4.5%) slumps after disclosing COO Rajiv Khemani has resigned " to pursue opportunities which are not competitive with the Company's business." Shares of the network processor vendor have been treading water for a while, as high multiples offset expectations of strong 2013 growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • SD

    SandRidge Energy (SD -4%) is cut to Sell from Hold at Canaccord, after shares have rallied on...

    SandRidge Energy (SD -4%) is cut to Sell from Hold at Canaccord, after shares have rallied on the "unfounded expectation" of a takeover. Also, market indications suggest the current clearing price for acreage in the heart of the Mississippian play is ~$1,500/acre including associated production; a Permian sale does not improve SD's long-term financial standing, the firm says.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 2 Comments
  • VVUS

    Shares of Vivus (VVUS) +10.1% after a Bloomberg report says that, according to Symphony Health...

    Shares of Vivus (VVUS) +10.1% after a Bloomberg report says that, according to Symphony Health Solutions data, Qsymia prescriptions jumped 46% week-over-week.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • TMUS

    MetroPCS (PCS -2.2%) has sold off following news Clearwire's board has approved the full sale of...

    MetroPCS (PCS -2.2%) has sold off following news Clearwire's board has approved the full sale of the company to Sprint. Shares had already slumped this month on a Reuters report Sprint is unlikely to make a bid for the carrier before the SoftBank deal closes, something that could preclude an offer from happening before MetroPCS' planned merger with T-Mobile USA goes through.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • INFA

    Informatica (INFA +3.6%) is up for the sixth trading day in a row after receiving an upgrade to...

    Informatica (INFA +3.6%) is up for the sixth trading day in a row after receiving an upgrade to Overweight from Piper. The firm says industry contacts indicate the worst of the company's European execution issues (played a big role in the Q3 warning) are behind it, and that its latest CIO survey "shows stabilized INFA spending plans for 2013." It also thinks a lot of bad news is priced in at current levels. Shares are now up 21% from their Dec. 7 close.  (previous: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • SAM

    Something is about to give up with Boston Beer (SAM +3%) after the company lifted its outlook...

    Something is about to give up with Boston Beer (SAM +3%) after the company lifted its outlook for FY12 profits last week. For believers of social media sentiment tracking, the stock moved from neutral to strong positive. But also in the mix, shorts still hold a dominating position of 34% of all outstanding shares. SAM +21% since hiking guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • SINA

    Sina (SINA +4.4%) is rallying, apparently on a report the company will announce a partnership...

    Sina (SINA +4.4%) is rallying, apparently on a report the company will announce a partnership next week with Chinese Android OEM Xiaomi. The tie-up is said to possibly involve Sina's Meyou messaging service and Xiaomi's Miliao, with the goal of taking on messaging giant Tencent's (OTCPK:TCEHY) WeChat. Sina took off last month on a rumor about an Alibaba investment, but no deal arrived.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • CBOU

    Shares of Caribou Coffee (CBOU +30%) soar right past $16 which marks the price Joh. A. Bencksier...

    Shares of Caribou Coffee (CBOU +30%) soar right past $16 which marks the price Joh. A. Bencksier has on the table for the company. The cheerful rally is an indication that at least a few traders are speculating a higher offer could come down the pike. Though Caribou Coffee is the second largest coffee chain behind Starbucks and could add to its retail footprint, the early read on the deal from Starbucks (SBUX +1.6%) investors leans toward indifference.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • ENZN

    Shares of Enzon Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ENZN) have resumed trading following an earlier halt, and...

    Shares of Enzon Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ENZN) have resumed trading following an earlier halt, and the shares are currently up 5.4%. Carl Icahn has a 13.29% stake in Enzon, and disclosed in November that he and his associates wanted to discuss the operations and direction of the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • CPWR

    Activist investor Elliott Management has offered to buy Compuware (CPWR +12.5%) for $11/share in...

    Activist investor Elliott Management has offered to buy Compuware (CPWR +12.5%) for $11/share in cash, or $2.3B. Shares have soared to $10.76. Elliott recently raised its stake in Compuware to 5.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • NOK

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +3.2%) adds to the Friday gains it saw on news of its financing deal thanks...

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +3.2%) adds to the Friday gains it saw on news of its financing deal thanks to positive sell-side activity. Evercore is starting coverage at Overweight, and Natixis has upgraded shares to Buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 3 Comments
  • CRUS

    Citi downgrade or not, it's relief rally time for many (though not all) Apple suppliers: the...

    Citi downgrade or not, it's relief rally time for many (though not all) Apple suppliers: the group was clobbered on Thursday and Friday as negative supply chain/order data came in. CRUS +4.3%. BRCM +1.4%. QCOM +2.4%. AVGO +1.5%. SWKS +3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM | 6 Comments
  • END

    Endeavour International (END -21.1%) says a previously announced deal to acquire ConocoPhillips'...

    Endeavour International (END -21.1%) says a previously announced deal to acquire ConocoPhillips' (NYSE:COP) interest in U.K. oil fields in the North Sea has been terminated after failing to agree on terms related to the timing and amount of collateral required for future decommissioning costs. The deal's collapse prompts a share downgrade by Global Hunter, to Accumulate from Buy.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM | 3 Comments
  • JBLU

    Airline stocks race to early gains after Dahlman Rose issues a sweeping upgrade on the sector....

    Airline stocks race to early gains after Dahlman Rose issues a sweeping upgrade on the sector. Advancers include JetBlue (JBLU +3.1%), United Continental (UAL +3.3%), US Airways (LCC +1.1%), and Delta Air Lines (DAL +2.3%). The bullish call from the firm: "We're going all in."
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • TROX

    A weak global economy has quashed demand for titanium dioxide, a white pigment used in paints...

    A weak global economy has quashed demand for titanium dioxide, a white pigment used in paints and coatings, but Barron's says that's left shares of Tronox (TROX +6.6%), one of the ingredient's largest producers, looking cheap as sales revive. The stock is trading at a ~37% discount to its stated book value of $25 and for 6.6x next year's estimated earnings.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • AUQ

    AuRico Gold (NYSE:AUQ) +3.6% premarket on plans to buy back up to 300M shares via a modified...

    AuRico Gold (NYSE:AUQ) +3.6% premarket on plans to buy back up to 300M shares via a modified Dutch auction at a price of $8.30-$9.30/share. The move follows AUQ's receipt of $750M in gross proceeds relating to the recent sale of the Ocampo mine.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM | 2 Comments
  • CBOU

    Coffee consolidation: The buyer of Caribou Coffee (NASDAQ:CBOU), Joh. A. Benckiser, already...

    Coffee consolidation: The buyer of Caribou Coffee (NASDAQ:CBOU), Joh. A. Benckiser, already dipped into the sector with a $974M deal to buy Peet's Coffee & Tea last summer. The quick analyst take on the new acquisition is that a Caribou-Peet's consolidation could percolate. Coffee Holdings (NASDAQ:JVA) is catching a bid off the news, up 8.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM | 1 Comment
  • JVA

    Premarket gainers: JVA +12%. OTC:ENZN +10%. CBMX +10%. LXRX +9%. TROX +6%. CTIC +5%. Losers: NBG...

    Premarket gainers: JVA +12%. OTC:ENZN +10%. CBMX +10%. LXRX +9%. TROX +6%. CTIC +5%.
    Losers: NBG -13%. CLWR -11%. SQNM -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • LXRX

    Lexicon Pharma (NASDAQ:LXRX) +8.5% premarket after its LX1033 drug candidate for irritable bowel...

    Lexicon Pharma (NASDAQ:LXRX) +8.5% premarket after its LX1033 drug candidate for irritable bowel syndrome receives fast track status from the FDA.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • CQP

    Cheniere Energy Partners (NYSEMKT:CQP) and Total (NYSE:TOT) sign a 20-year agreement to purchase...

    Cheniere Energy Partners (NYSEMKT:CQP) and Total (NYSE:TOT) sign a 20-year agreement to purchase liquefied natural gas exports from Sabine Pass. TOT will purchase 91.25MMBtu of LNG annually plus 13.5MMBtu of seasonal LNG volumes upon the commencement of train five operations. CQP +2.8%, LNG +4%, TOT +1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM | 4 Comments

  • Stock futures move to session highs - the S&P 500 +0.4%, Nasdaq 100 +0.4% - amid some very...

    Stock futures move to session highs - the S&P 500 +0.4%, Nasdaq 100 +0.4% - amid some very bullish comments from David Tepper on CNBC. Dropping below $500/share earlier following a curiously timed downgrade, Apple now +0.5% to $512.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM
  • AG

    First Majestic Silver (NYSE:AG) -5.7% premarket after last night's news it is acquiring Orko...

    First Majestic Silver (NYSE:AG) -5.7% premarket after last night's news it is acquiring Orko Silver (OTC:OKOFF) in a friendly deal. The all-stock offer implies a value of C$2.72/share, representing a ~69% premium to Orko's volume-weighted average price for the past 30 days.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM | 7 Comments
  • WFT

    Weatherford International (NYSE:WFT) +1.4% premarket after saying it is filing with the SEC its...

    Weatherford International (NYSE:WFT) +1.4% premarket after saying it is filing with the SEC its 10-Q forms for Q2 and Q3 2012 as well as an amended 10-Q for Q1 and FY 2011. WFT has been hobbled by a number of accounting-related issues arising from an audit dating back several years.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM | 1 Comment
  • S

    Reopened for trade, Clearwire (CLWR) falls 8.3% to $3.09 premarket after its board approved the...

    Reopened for trade, Clearwire (CLWR) falls 8.3% to $3.09 premarket after its board approved the sale of the company to Sprint (NYSE:S) for $2.97/share. Sprint gains 2.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:57 AM | 7 Comments
  • AAPL

    Brian White tries to ride to the rescue of Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL), reiterating his $1,111 price...

    Brian White tries to ride to the rescue of Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL), reiterating his $1,111 price target after the company reported selling more than 2M iPhone 5s in its first 3 days of official availability in China. Also leaning against the Citi downgrade are Morgan Stanley and Barclays. Shares are bouncing from premarket lows, -1.4% to $502.49.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:42 AM | 36 Comments
  • VOD

    Vodafone (NASDAQ:VOD) shares sink 2.9% in London after the company agreed to pay €1.4B for...

    Vodafone (NASDAQ:VOD) shares sink 2.9% in London after the company agreed to pay €1.4B for Dutch 4G spectrum in an auction that raised €3.8B in total from KPN, T-Mobile and Tele2, as well as from Vodafone. Investors are concerned about the amount operators are going to have to shell out in auctions across Europe, although cash-strapped governments are probably delighted.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:37 AM | 1 Comment

  • Asian stocks are mixed but European shares are lower in the last full trading week before...

    Asian stocks are mixed but European shares are lower in the last full trading week before Christmas. Japan rose and the yen weakened after the LDP party won a landslide in yesterday's election and immediately set out to fulfill its promise to make the BOJ print more money that the new government can throw at the economy. Japan +0.9%, Hong Kong -0.4%, China +0.5%, India -0.3%. EU Stoxx 50 -0.3%, London -0.3%, Paris -0.6%, Frankfurt +0.1%, Milan flat, Madrid -0.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 AM
